intro: Gnidia filamentosa var. virens, commonly known as the green-flowered gnidia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers that are typically borne in terminal clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native range.
